data.title: RACING: Golan's victory sets up chance for Arc.

IT'S next stop the Arc for Golan after he scored a convincing victory at Longchamp.

He booked his place in next month's Prix de l'Arc de Triomph-Lucien Barriere with a stylish success.

But Sir Michael Stoute's British raider may face stiff competition in the middle-distance championship event, judged by the impressive success of French filly Aquarelliste in the following race.

Golan justified 13-10 favouritism in the Prix Niel Casino Barriere d'Enghien les Bains, scoring by three quarters of a length from French Derby hero Anabaa Blue with Chichicastenango two lengths back in third.

It was Anabaa Blue who cut out the early pace under Christophe Soumillon but Kieren Fallon made his challenge aboard Golan with two furlongs to travel and stuck on well to score in workmanlike fashion.

"He was in front too soon but I got the perfect split and we had to go," said Fallon. "He felt great, as he goes around here. He's definitely a real Arc horse.

The other British raider, Storming Home, was last of the seven and has finished for the season but stays in training next year.

Aquarelliste oozed class as she ran out an impressive winner of the Prix Vermeille.

The Daniel Wildenstein-owned filly, trained by Elie Lellouche, quickened nicely for Dominic Boeuf to score by a short neck from Diamilina.

Alec Wildenstein, the owner's son, said: "She is a really exceptional filly. When she accelerates, the race is over."

Mot Juste fared best of the British raiders, holding Irish challenger Karsavina for fourth place.

The British raiding party had got the day off to the best possible start when the Paul Cole-trained Guys And Dolls struck in the Prix la Rochette.

NEWMARKET trainer Mick Quinlan's four-pronged juvenile assault on Milan on Saturday paid off with a winner, a third and two fourths.

The stable's Mac King (24-10) landed the Premio Gudo over an extended seven furlongs for newcomers by a length and a quarter under Palmerio Agus.

Quinlan's Cambrizia (Agus), placed on her Merano debut, was again in the money with a close third to Silvestre in the Premio Melzo.
